artist: Hashiguchi Goyō (self-published); Carved by Koike Masazō; Printed by Akimoto Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: woman wearing an open black kimono with white flowers, seated on an orange cushion with white flowers; shiny silver ground
marks: 大正九年六月 {Taishō kunen rokugatsu} (June 1920) 五葉画 {Goyō ga} (picture by Goyō)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica
text: Portrait of Nakatani Tsuru 中谷つる.
title: Woman in Summer Clothing
